skyc/skyc.c File Reference

This file contains main routine that does the job management and calls setup_parms and then skysim to start the simulation. More...


Functions

int main (int argc, char **argv)
 The main().

Detailed Description

This file contains main routine that does the job management and calls setup_parms and then skysim to start the simulation.

Function Documentation

int main ( int  argc,
char **  argv 
)

The main().

It parses the command line, setup the parms, ask the scheduler for signal to proceed, and then starts skysim to do sky coverage. 

00030                                {
00031     if(strcmp(argv[0], "scheduler")==0){//launch the scheduler.
00032     scheduler();
00033     exit(0);
00034     }
00035     dirstart=mygetcwd();
00036     //Strip out PATH information from the command line.
00037     char*fn=mybasename(argv[0]);
00038     strcpy(argv[0],fn);
00039     free(fn);
00040     
00041     ARG_S* arg=parse_args(argc,argv);
00042     /*In detach mode send to background and disable drawing*/
00043     if(arg->detach){
00044     disable_draw=1;//disable drawing.
00045     daemonize();
00046     }
00047     info2("Output folder is '%s' %d threads\n",arg->dirout, arg->nthread);
00048 
00049 #ifdef SVN_REV
00050     if(strlen(SVN_REV)>1 && strcmp(SVN_REV,"exported")){
00051     info2("MAOS Version %s, Revision %s,",PACKAGE_VERSION,SVN_REV);
00052     }
00053 #else
00054     info2("MAOS Version %s,",PACKAGE_VERSION);
00055 #endif
00056     info2("Launched at %s in %s.\n",myasctime(),myhostname());
00057 
00058     fprintf(stderr, "Compiled on %s %s by %s ",
00059         __DATE__, __TIME__, __VERSION__);
00060 #ifdef __OPTIMIZE__
00061     fprintf(stderr, "with optimization.\n");
00062 #else
00063     fprintf(stderr, "without optimization!!!\n");
00064 #endif
00065     //register signal handler
00066     register_signal_handler(skyc_signal_handler);
00067     /*
00068       Ask job scheduler for permission to proceed. If no CPUs are available,
00069       will block until ones are available.  if arg->force==1, will run
00070       immediately.
00071     */
00072     char *cwd=mygetcwd();
00073     int slen=strlen(cwd)+2;
00074     for(int iarg=0; iarg<argc; iarg++){
00075     slen+=1+strlen(argv[iarg]);
00076     }
00077     char scmd[slen];
00078     char *home=getenv("HOME");//don't free
00079     if(!strncmp(cwd,home,strlen(home))){
00080     strcpy(scmd,"~");
00081     strcat(scmd,cwd+strlen(home));
00082     }else{
00083     strcpy(scmd,cwd);
00084     }
00085     strcat(scmd,"/");
00086     for(int iarg=0; iarg<argc; iarg++){
00087     strcat(scmd,argv[iarg]);
00088     strcat(scmd," ");
00089     }
00090     if(strlen(scmd)>slen-1) error("Overflow\n");
00091     scheduler_start(scmd,arg->nthread,!arg->force);
00092     //setting up parameters before asking scheduler to check for any errors.
00093     dirsetup=stradd("setup",NULL);
00094     PARMS_S * parms=setup_parms(arg);
00095     if(parms->skyc.dbg){
00096     mymkdir("%s",dirsetup);
00097     }
00098     if(!arg->force){
00099     info2("Waiting start signal from the scheduler ...\n");
00100     /*Failed to wait. fall back to own checking.*/
00101     int count=0;
00102     while(scheduler_wait()&& count<60){
00103         warning3("failed to get reply from scheduler. retry\n");
00104         sleep(10);
00105         count++;
00106         scheduler_start(scmd,arg->nthread,!arg->force);
00107     }
00108     if(count>=60){
00109         warning3("fall back to own checker\n");
00110         wait_cpu(arg->nthread);
00111     }
00112     }
00113     info2("Simulation started at %s in %s.\n",myasctime(),myhostname());
00114  
00115     free(arg);
00116     /*Loads the main software*/
00117 #if USE_PTHREAD == 2
00118     if(parms->skyc.nthread>1)
00119     default_pool=thr_pool_create(1,parms->skyc.nthread,3600,NULL);
00120 #endif
00121     skysim(parms);
00122     free_parms(parms);
00123     skyc_done(0);
00124     free(cwd);
00125     free(dirsetup);
00126     free(dirstart);
00127     info2("End:\t%.2f MiB\n",get_job_mem()/1024.);
00128     info2("Simulation finished at %s in %s.\n",myasctime(),myhostname());
00129     return 0;
00130 }
